description: Second smallest m such that (2n-1)2^m+1 is prime, or -1 if no such value exists.
comments: There exist odd integers 2k-1 such that (2k-1)2^n+1 is always composite.
references: Ribenboim, P. The New Book of Prime Number Records. New York: Springer-Verlag, pp. 357-359, 1996.
links: Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Riesel Number.
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Sierpiński Number of the Second Kind
mathematica: max = 10000 (* this maximum value of m is sufficient up to n=191 *); a[n_] := Reap[ For[m = 1; cnt = 0, m <= max && cnt < 2, m++, If[m == max, Sow[-1], If[PrimeQ[(2*n - 1)*2^m + 1], cnt++; Sow[m]]]]][[2, 1]]; a[1] = {0, 1}; Table[a[n][[2]], {n, 1, 88}] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Feb 27 2013 *)
author: _Eric W. Weisstein_
